deeprules._timing
=================

.. py:module:: deeprules._timing


Classes
-------

.. autoapisummary::

   deeprules._timing.PerformanceTimer


Module Contents
---------------

.. py:class:: PerformanceTimer

   Context manager class for measuring the CPU execution time of a code block.
   Class is using time.perf_counter() function to measure time under the hood.

   Example:
   >>> with PerformanceTimer() as timer:
   ...     time.sleep(0.5)
   >>> print(timer)


   .. py:attribute:: start_time
      :type:  float
      :value: None



   .. py:attribute:: end_time
      :type:  float
      :value: None



   .. py:attribute:: _time
      :type:  float
      :value: None



   .. py:method:: __enter__()


   .. py:method:: __exit__(*args, **kwargs)


   .. py:method:: __str__() -> str


   .. py:property:: time
      :type: float


      Returns:
          float: time in seconds



   .. py:property:: timedelta
      :type: datetime.timedelta


      Returns:
          timedelta:  datetime timedelta object
